labels.proConfig: Want to configure all details as easy as this?
labels.discoverProDetails: More functionality (like RSVP) and way less trouble thanks to managed ics file hosting, no-code customization, and more.
labels.discoverProDetails_short: Want more functionality and way less trouble?

meta.title: {title} {'|'} Free Add to Calendar Button
meta.title_main: Try this Add to Calendar Button
meta.keywords: calendar, event, sharing, button, script, widget, rsvp, javascript, angular, react, vue, svelte, astro, web component, outlook, ical, microsoft, teams, apple, google, yahoo, free
meta.description: Experience the interactive demo and tutorials on how to create a button, which adds events to your users' calendars. Free, quick, and convenient.

examples.description: Interactive examples for common Add to Calendar use cases. All-day, multi-date, recurrence, link styling, and more.

use.description: Learn how to install and implement the Add to Calendar Button in under 1 minutes with basic JavaScript at any frontend stack.

advanced-use.description: Advanced interactive examples for all kinds of complex event sharing and Add to Calendar Button cases.

use-with-angular.description: Learn how to install and implement the Add to Calendar Button in under 1 minutes with Angular. Making use of the maybe most powerful and stable library.

use-with-astro.description: Learn how to install and implement the Add to Calendar Button in under 1 minutes with Astro. Making use of the maybe most powerful and stable library.

use-with-react.description: Learn how to install and implement the maybe most powerful and stable Add to Calendar Button in under 1 minutes; using React with or without TypeScript.

use-with-svelte.description: Learn how to install and implement the Add to Calendar Button in under 1 minutes with Svelte. Making use of the maybe most powerful and stable library.

use-with-vue.description: Learn how to install and implement the Add to Calendar Button in under 1 minutes with Vue 3. Making use of the maybe most powerful and stable library.

use-with-wordpress.description: Learn how to install and implement the maybe most powerful and stable Add to Calendar Button with our WordPress Plugn in under 1 minutes.

configuration.description: Scroll through all possible configuration parameters, made for you to customize our Add to Calendar Button to your needs.

seo.title: About Add to Calendar Buttons, Links, and more
seo.description: What is an Add to Calendar Button? How can users save and share my events without any struggle? All details, links, and tools.

404.intro: Unfortunately, the requested page is not available.

home.intro_slogan_1: Let your users add events to their calendar
home.intro_block_1: Welcome to the maybe most convenient way working with Add to Calendar Buttons.
home.intro_block_2: Designed to reduce developer headaches down to zero.
home.intro_block_3: Supporting all major calendars; in all modern browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari); on Windows, Mac, Android, and iOS as well as rather restricted webview environments like the Instagram in-app browser.
home.intro_block_4: Built as a Web Component, that you can easily integrate basically everywhere. Enjoy!
home.headline_installation: Bringing it to your web project
home.functionality_intro: Simple and convenient integration of 1 or many buttons, configurable directly within the HTML code!
home.demoDisclaimer: The playground only holds a subset of the available options. Check the "Configuration" page for more:

installation.intro_1: The script is built as a "Web Component".
installation.intro_2: This means that you can use it similar to any other HTML element and it is working out-of-the-box for all setups.
installation.intro_3: Find a step-by-step guide by selecting your environment.
installation.other_stack_2: The default setup is the way to go!

block_1.5: Automatically generated iCal/ics files (for all other calendars and cases).

block_2.4: Most robust time zone and daylight saving management (via our own TimeZones iCal Library).

block_4.1: Optimized and adjustable UX (for desktop and mobile).
block_4.3: Taking care of all those edge cases, where some scenarios do not support specific setups (like WebView blocking downloads); utilizing beautiful user guidance workarounds.
block_4.4: Full support for mouse, touch, or keyboard input (W3C WAI compliant).
block_4.5: Supporting 20+ languages, incl. RTL text for Arabic & Persian; but also custom labels and text blocks (i18n).

block_5.1: Auto-generated Schema.org rich (structured) data for better SEO.
block_5.2: Fully GDPR, CCPA, and LGPD compliant - without the need of signing some data processing agreement.

guide.step_cdn_p1: Load the respective script by adding the following script tag to the head section of your website.
guide.step_cdn_p2: The script will be loaded in a non-blocking way. So you don't need to worry about where to include it exactly.
guide.step_use_start: Start using it by adding a <add-to-calendar-button> tag to your HTML source code - with the options as attributes.
guide.step_use_example: Your code block could look like the following:
guide.install_npm: Install the package from the npm registry.
guide.import_npm: Import the module into the component, where you want to use the button.
guide.options_intro_1: We will highlight all options below.

general.headline: How to install the Add to Calendar Button

angular.headline: How to install the Add to Calendar Button with Angular
angular.config_1: To make Angular work properly with the Web Component, you need to import the
angular.binding_guide_1: To bind data to a specific attribute, you need to use the syntax [attr.PARAMETER]="your data".
angular.binding_guide_2: Based on your setup, the data flow might happen after the first rendering of the button. This is no problem, but you might see errors in the console when in debug mode, claiming there is data missing. Mind that due to this reason, binding the "identifier" option would not work.

astro.headline: How to install the Add to Calendar Button with Astro
astro.ssg_intro_1: For static site generators (SSG), we generally recommend to load the Add to Calendar Button script via CDN.
astro.ssg_intro_2: Alternatively, you can still use the npm package and include the module via an observer function.
astro.npm_alternative_1: Alternatively, install the package from the npm registry.
astro.npm_alternative_2: ...and setup an Observer to load the script properly:

react.headline: How to install the Add to Calendar Button with React
react.pick_intro: As React projects can be very versatile, there are multiple potential ways to work with the Add to Calendar Button.
react.pick_option1: In rather basic projects, you can use the Web Component out-of-the-box.
react.pick_option2: If you are using TypeScript, you would need to define a respective interface.
react.pick_option3_1: In all cases, you could also use the
react.pick_option3_2: official Add to Calendar Button React Wrapper
react.pick_option3_3: instead of the main script. This comes with a deeper TypeScript and React integration.
react.install_wrapper: If you rather go with the more specialized React Wrapper, install the following package instead:
react.import_wrapper: With the React Wrapper implementation, the import statement looks a little bit different.
react.step_optimize_ts: Optimize the TypeScript config for the Web Component
react.optimize_ts_1: This step is only necessary if you are NOT using the React Wrapper AND if you are working with TypeScript!
react.optimize_ts_2: In this case, you would need to define a respective global JSX interface. You do this within a *.d.ts type file (like "global.d.ts"), which needs to be picked up by your tsconfig (there, you should specify the "typeRoots" option).
react.start_wrapper_1: If you went for the React Wrapper, you would specify a button by using the <AddtoCalendarButton> tag instead. Basically, you then use the imported React component instead of the custom element (Web Component).
react.start_wrapper_2: Your code block would then look rather like this:
react.start_wrapper_3: Mind that with the Wrapper approach, you can provide Array options as actual Arrays, while with the Web Component, they need to be transformed to Strings!
react.start_wrapper_4: Keep this style and specialties in mind when you look at more examples around here.
react.start_wrapper_5: On other pages, we rather focus on the Web Component approach, but this can always easily transferred to the React Wrapper style.

svelte.headline: How to install the Add to Calendar Button with Svelte

vue.headline: How to install the Add to Calendar Button with Vue 3
vue.optimize_2: Vue works extremely well with Web Components.
vue.config_1: However, you might notice a warning in the browser console.
vue.config_2: To get rid of this, you need to provide a little bit more information to the compiler options.
vue.config_3: This can go into your vite.config.js or other places depending on your setup. Check the official Vue documentation for more details
vue.config_4: In case the Add to Calendar Button is the only Web Component in your project, you could also be a little bit more explicit here.
vue.config_5: In this case, our recommendation is to define tags, which start with "add-" as "custom elements".

wordpress.headline: How to install the Add to Calendar Button with WordPress
wordpress.install_2: official package from the WordPress Plugin Directory.
wordpress.install_way_1: You can find it directly from the "Plugins" page within your admin dashboard.
wordpress.install_way_2_3: and upload the zip file to your WordPress system. OR you unzip and upload the plugin manually into your
wordpress.activate: At your WordPress "Plugins" page, activate the plugin.
wordpress.block: Simply use the "Block" within the WordPress Gutenberg Block Editor.
wordpress.block_step1: Add a new block and search for "Add to Calendar Button".
wordpress.block_step3: Add the attributes of your choice at the input on the right side "Block" settings.
wordpress.shortcode1: Alternatively, you can also use the shortcode [add-to-calendar-button] and add the attributes directly to it:
wordpress.shortcode2: Mind that you cannot use '[' and ']' characters in this case! For content formatting, you can use {'{'}*{'}'} instead of [*].
